intro: Bupleurum angolense, commonly known as Angolan sieboldia, is a herbaceous perennial plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes many aromatic and medicinal plants. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and finely divided leaves. Its flowers are small and yellowish-green, arranged in umbels, and it blooms during the cooler months. Bupleurum angolense is often found in grasslands and rocky areas, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
